meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jon Lubin Elsa Angrist Alex Irvine Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7104.

td.p: Jon Lubin, an attorney originally from Stony Brook, New York
Elsa Angrist, a retired computer consultant from Arlington, Virginia
Alex Irvine, a writer originally from Ypsilanti, Michigan (whose 1-day cash winnings total $26,000)

tr.td: SOLE MEN
ALPHABETICALLY FIRST
ANIMALS, VEGETABLES, MINERALS
MULTI-BAND MUSICIANS
MIDDLE F
USS COD
(Sarah: Not as menacing a name as Shark or Barracuda, but she helped win the war in the Pacific.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Jon: What is Doc Marten?)
[Initially accepted as correct; reversed before Double Jeopardy!]

Doc Martens

Jon
Triple Stumper
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'A German army medic named Kklaus was the "Doc" behind this boot brand')

tr.td: A German army medic named Kklaus was the "Doc" behind this boot brand

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew bunks in the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) Living quarters on the Cod were cramped, with three crewmen taking turns sharing two bunks; the upper one I\'m in, with extra headroom to accommodate the torpedo-loading hatch, was called this--a term for a top-floor, luxurious apartment')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew bunks in the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) Living quarters on the Cod were cramped, with three crewmen taking turns sharing two bunks; the upper one I'm in, with extra headroom to accommodate the torpedo-loading hatch, was called this--a term for a top-floor, luxurious apartment

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_2', 'clue_J_6_2_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows off a torpedo tube on the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) Thanks to its torpedo data computer, the cod could fire guided weapons; a spindle slipped into the torpedo\'s side was used to set the course into an internal one of these spinning devices, from Greek for "circle watcher"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows off a torpedo tube on the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) Thanks to its torpedo data computer, the cod could fire guided weapons; a spindle slipped into the torpedo's side was used to set the course into an internal one of these spinning devices, from Greek for "circle watcher"

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_3', 'clue_J_6_3_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew stands topside on the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) On her last patrol, the Cod rescued the men of a Dutch submarine stranded on a mid-ocean reef; to keep the Dutch boat out of enemy hands, the crew used torpedoes & on-deck guns to do this, meaning to intentionally sink a friendly ship')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew stands topside on the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) On her last patrol, the Cod rescued the men of a Dutch submarine stranded on a mid-ocean reef; to keep the Dutch boat out of enemy hands, the crew used torpedoes & on-deck guns to do this, meaning to intentionally sink a friendly ship

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_4', 'clue_J_6_4_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from inside the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) On May 10, 1944, the Cod fought its biggest battle; after engaging a convoy & sinking a destroyer, the crew stayed submerged for 12 hours in temperatures over 110 degrees, sweating out an attack by more than 70 of these underwater bombs')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from inside the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) On May 10, 1944, the Cod fought its biggest battle; after engaging a convoy & sinking a destroyer, the crew stayed submerged for 12 hours in temperatures over 110 degrees, sweating out an attack by more than 70 of these underwater bombs

The Cod\'s conning tower records her 47 combat victories--21 ships & 26 smaller vessels; most of them took place while on patrol in this sea, between the Philippines & Vietnam')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the deck of the USS Cod in Cleveland, OH.) The Cod's conning tower records her 47 combat victories--21 ships & 26 smaller vessels; most of them took place while on patrol in this sea, between the Philippines & Vietnam

tr.td: Alex
Elsa
Jon

tr.td: Alex
Elsa
Jon
THE MONARCHS OF ENGLAND
U.S. MARSHALS

LITERATURE OF THE EARLY 1800s
"SALT" & "PEPPER"
